title: Theory of flight
brief_description: Wind tunnel tests demonstrate the relation between air velocity and lift and drag on plain and cambered air-foils; control of aeroplane movements about vertical, lateral, and longitudinal axes by means of rudder, elevator, and ailerons respectively, are demonstrated.
description: Wind tunnel tests demonstrate the relation between air velocity and lift and drag on plain and cambered air-foils; control of aeroplane movements about vertical, lateral, and longitudinal axes by means of rudder, elevator, and ailerons respectively, are demonstrated.
